item.title: How and When to Use For Loops
item.description: What is a for loop? A for loop is a process that lets you automate a portion of your code by repeating a sequence of instructions a specified number of times.

item.title: Introduction to ggplot2
item.description: TL:DR: If you are new to ggplot, welcome! If you are used to base R, its probably going to take awhile for you to get the hang of the syntax, but trust me, itâ€™s worth it.

item.title: Another COVID-19 Dashboard
item.description: Recently there have been an overwhelming number of dashboards created to display COVID-19 data, so I decided to try my hand at it as well.

item.title: Learn Tidyverse: Pivot Functions
item.description: TL:DR : We will be using the pivot longer and pivot wider functions to change the shape of our dataframe.
